detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for rekey transactions but does not prevent them from being processed if the condition is met. This could allow an attacker to change the authorization address of the account.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not validate the transaction fee, which could lead to fee exploitation where an attacker sets an unusually high fee.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary delete
detected_vulns.description: The contract allows the application to be deleted without any restrictions, which could lead to loss of data or funds if not properly managed.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not validate the receiver of payments, which could lead to funds being sent to unintended addresses.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary delete
detected_vulns.description: The contract allows any sender to delete the application without proper authorization checks.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary update
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks if the sender is the zero address for updates, which is incorrect as it should verify against the creator's address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for rekey transactions but only logs and returns 0, which might not be sufficient depending on the intended security model.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not verify the transaction fee, which could lead to fee-related vulnerabilities.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract processes payment transactions but does not verify the receiver address, potentially allowing funds to be sent to unintended addresses.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not check the transaction fee, which could lead to potential fee-related vulnerabilities.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary delete
detected_vulns.description: The contract allows any sender to delete the application without proper authorization checks, except for the initial check on the sender not being the creator in some cases.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not specify or check the payment receiver in transactions, which could lead to funds being sent to unintended addresses.

detected_vulns.description: The contract allows any user to delete the application without proper authorization checks, only checking if the sender is the creator during updates but not deletions.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary Update
detected_vulns.description: The contract allows arbitrary updates to global state (App.globalPut(Txn.application_args[0], Txn.application_args[1])) without proper validation of the caller's authority or the data being written, which could lead to unauthorized modifications.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not check the transaction fee, which could lead to users paying excessive fees or the contract being vulnerable to fee-related attacks.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not verify the receiver of the payment transactions (Gtxn[0] and Gtxn[2]) in the 'handle_operation' function, which could lead to funds being sent to unintended addresses.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary update
detected_vulns.description: The 'update_admin' function allows any sender to update the admin key without proper authorization checks, potentially leading to unauthorized changes in the contract's admin.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not verify the transaction fees for the grouped transactions, which could result in higher than expected fees being paid.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary delete
detected_vulns.description: The 'delete_application' function checks if the sender is the current admin but does not verify the transaction's fee or other parameters, which could be exploited if the admin's account is compromised.

detected_vulns.description: The contract does not verify the receiver of the payment transactions (Gtxn[0] and Gtxn[2]) in the 'handle_operation' function, which could lead to funds being sent to unintended addresses.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary update
detected_vulns.description: The contract allows any user to update the application without any restrictions or checks, which could lead to malicious updates.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not check or limit the transaction fee, which could lead to excessive fees being paid.

detected_vulns.description: The contract allows arbitrary updates to the global state without proper validation of the input data.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The transaction fee is checked in all transactions, but the condition in txn3 uses OR, which means only one of the conditions needs to be true, potentially allowing a transaction with a high fee to pass if other conditions are met.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The rekey_to field is checked in all transactions, but similar to the fee, in txn3 it's part of an OR condition, which might allow a transaction with rekey_to set if other conditions are met.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The close_remainder_to field is checked in all transactions, but in txn3 it's part of an OR condition, potentially allowing a transaction with close_remainder_to set if other conditions are met.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The receiver in payment transactions is not explicitly checked in txn1 and txn3, which could lead to funds being sent to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The asset receiver in asset transfer transactions is not explicitly checked in txn2 and txn4, which could lead to assets being sent to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Close To
detected_vulns.description: The asset transfer transaction (txn_1) does not check the 'asset_close_to' field, which could allow an attacker to specify an arbitrary address to receive the remaining assets.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The payment transaction (txn_2) does not verify the 'receiver' field against a whitelist or specific condition, potentially allowing funds to be sent to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: While the transaction fees are checked against 'max_fee', the 'max_fee' value is hardcoded and not dynamically verified, which could lead to inefficiencies or vulnerabilities if the network conditions change.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary Update
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not include mechanisms to prevent arbitrary updates to the smart contract logic, which could be exploited if the contract is upgradable without proper authorization.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The asset receiver is hardcoded to a specific address without any validation checks, which could lead to assets being sent to an unintended recipient.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The transaction fee is checked to be less than or equal to a maximum amount, but there's no lower bound check, potentially allowing for fee manipulation.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The rekey_to field is checked to be the zero address, which is correct, but without additional context, it's unclear if this is always the desired behavior.

detected_vulns.name: Hardcoded Values
detected_vulns.description: The contract uses hardcoded values for the asset receiver, maximum amount, and expiration time, which reduces flexibility and could lead to issues if these values need to be changed.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not verify the receiver in transaction 3 (tx3_check), allowing any receiver to be specified as long as the amount is less than or equal to 'amount'.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: Transaction 5 (tx5_check) is an AssetTransfer but does not specify or verify the asset receiver, which could lead to assets being sent to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: All transactions check that the fee is below a certain threshold but do not enforce a minimum fee, potentially allowing transactions with fees that are too low to be processed in a timely manner.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: While transactions 1-4 set 'close_remainder_to' to the zero address, transaction 5 (tx5_check) does not check or set 'close_remainder_to', which could lead to unintended account closures.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: All transactions except for the potential issue in transaction 5 (tx5_check) set 'rekey_to' to the zero address, but transaction 5 does not explicitly check or set 'rekey_to', which could allow rekeying.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not verify the asset receiver in the asset transfer transactions (Gtxn[0] and Gtxn[1]), which could lead to assets being sent to unintended addresses.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The payment transaction (Gtxn[2]) checks that the receiver is not the sender of the first asset transfer (Gtxn[0]), but does not specify or verify the intended receiver, potentially allowing payments to be sent to unintended addresses.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: While the contract checks that the transaction fees are below certain thresholds (Int(2500) for asset transfers and Int(1500) for payments), it does not ensure that the fees are reasonable or prevent front-running attacks by setting them too low.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The payment transaction (Gtxn[2]) correctly checks that 'close_remainder_to' is set to the zero address, preventing unintended account closures. No vulnerability detected.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: All transactions (Gtxn[0], Gtxn[1], Gtxn[2]) correctly check that 'rekey_to' is set to the zero address, preventing rekeying attacks. No vulnerability detected.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The transaction fee is checked to be less than or equal to 1000 microAlgos, but there's no validation against the minimum required fee, which could lead to underpaying fees in certain network conditions.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The receiver address is hardcoded, which might not be intended behavior in all cases, especially if the contract is meant to be reusable or if the receiver should be dynamically determined.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not explicitly handle the 'CloseRemainderTo' field, which could lead to unintended loss of funds if the transaction includes this field.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks that 'rekey_to' is the zero address, which is correct for preventing rekeying attacks. However, this is more of a best practice than a vulnerability in this context.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks if the fee is less than or equal to a certain amount but does not ensure it is not zero or below a reasonable minimum, which could lead to transaction spamming or other issues.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract specifies fixed payment receivers without verifying if they are the intended recipients, which could lead to funds being sent to incorrect addresses if the contract is misused.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: Similar to payment receivers, the contract specifies fixed asset receivers without dynamic checks, posing a risk of assets being sent to incorrect addresses.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The contract sets 'close_remainder_to' to the zero address in one transaction, but does not dynamically verify this field in all relevant transactions, which could lead to unintended account closures.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Close To
detected_vulns.description: The contract sets 'asset_close_to' to the zero address in asset transfer transactions, but lacks dynamic verification, potentially leading to unintended asset account closures.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for 'rekey_to' being the zero address in all transactions, which is correct, but does not dynamically verify this field against a list of allowed addresses or conditions, potentially limiting flexibility.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for rekey_to to be zero_address in a loop for all transactions, but does not explicitly check for rekey_to in each individual transaction outside the loop, which could lead to oversight in specific cases.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for close_remainder_to to be zero_address only for Payment transactions in a loop, but does not explicitly check for close_remainder_to in each individual Payment transaction outside the loop, which could lead to oversight in specific cases.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for fee to be within certain limits for each transaction type, but the limits are arbitrary and not justified, which could lead to vulnerabilities if the fees are not properly constrained.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract specifies fixed receivers for Payment transactions, which could be a vulnerability if the receivers are not intended to be fixed or if they are malicious.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract specifies fixed receivers for AssetTransfer transactions, which could be a vulnerability if the receivers are not intended to be fixed or if they are malicious.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks that the transaction fee is less than or equal to max_fee, but does not enforce a minimum fee, potentially allowing transactions with very low fees to be stuck in the mempool.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not verify the receiver for the main transaction (Txn.receiver() is set to Global.zero_address()), which might not be the intended behavior.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: For the asset transfer transaction (Gtxn[2]), the contract does not verify the asset receiver, which could lead to assets being sent to unintended addresses.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks that Gtxn[0].close_remainder_to() is Global.zero_address(), but does not perform similar checks for other transactions, potentially allowing unintended account closures.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks that rekey_to is Global.zero_address() for all transactions, which is correct, but the confidence is slightly reduced due to the complexity of the contract.

detected_vulns.name: Potential Logic Error
detected_vulns.description: The contract requires Txn.first_valid() > timeout_round for the main transaction, but Gtxn[1].first_valid() < timeout_round for the second payment, which might be a logic error depending on the intended use case.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks if the transaction fee is less than a template value but does not enforce a minimum fee, potentially allowing transactions with very low fees to be processed.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract specifies receivers in the template but does not validate the receivers dynamically, which could lead to funds being sent to unintended addresses if the template values are altered maliciously.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The contract sets 'close_remainder_to' to the zero address in 'split_transfer' but does not validate this field in 'split_close', potentially allowing assets to be sent to an arbitrary address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks if 'rekey_to' is the zero address in 'split_core' but does not enforce this in all transaction types, potentially allowing rekeying in some scenarios.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The transaction fee is checked to be less than or equal to a template value, but there's no check to ensure it's not zero or negative, which could lead to transactions being processed without fees.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The asset receivers are hardcoded to template values without dynamic checks, which could lead to assets being sent to unintended addresses if the template values are incorrect or maliciously set.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Close To
detected_vulns.description: The asset close to addresses are set to the zero address, which is a good practice to prevent accidental asset closures. However, there's no dynamic check to ensure this is always the case in all execution paths.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The rekey to addresses are set to the zero address, preventing rekeying. This is secure, but similar to asset close to, there's no dynamic check ensuring this in all paths.

detected_vulns.name: Potential Logic Error in Asset Amount
detected_vulns.description: The asset amount for the second transaction conditionally adds 1000 based on the latest timestamp being even. This could lead to unexpected behavior if not intended, but might be a feature rather than a vulnerability.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks if the transaction fee is less than a template value but does not ensure it is reasonable or within expected bounds, which could lead to insufficient fees for network operations.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract sets the rekey_to address to the zero address, which is correct for preventing rekeying attacks, but this is a standard practice and not a vulnerability.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: In the split_transfer condition, the contract ensures the close_remainder_to is set to the zero address, which is correct. However, in the split_close condition, it allows the close_remainder_to to be set to tmpl_own without additional checks, which could be a vulnerability if tmpl_own is not properly validated.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract specifies fixed receivers (tmpl_rcv1 and tmpl_rcv2) for the payments, which are hardcoded. This is not a vulnerability per se but limits the contract's flexibility and could be a risk if the addresses are compromised.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary Update
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not have mechanisms to prevent arbitrary updates to its parameters (like tmpl_fee, tmpl_rcv1, etc.), which could lead to unauthorized changes if not properly managed.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for rekey_to to be Global.zero_address() in split_core, which is correct. However, it's important to ensure this check is always enforced in all transaction paths.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for close_remainder_to to be Global.zero_address() in split_transfer and to be tmpl_own in split_close, which are correct checks for their respective paths.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract specifies receivers tmpl_rcv1 and tmpl_rcv2 in split_transfer, which are hardcoded and thus not vulnerable to arbitrary receiver attacks.

detected_vulns.description: The contract does not have any update mechanism, so there's no risk of arbitrary updates.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The close_remainder_to field for Gtxn[1], Gtxn[3], and Gtxn[4] is set to the zero address, which is correct and safe, but it's worth noting as it's a critical field that's being checked.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The rekey_to field for Gtxn[1], Gtxn[2], and Gtxn[5] is set to the zero address, which is correct and safe, but it's worth noting as it's a critical field that's being checked.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary Update
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not allow for arbitrary updates as all transaction fields are strictly checked against specific values or addresses.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary Delete
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not include any functionality for deletion, so this vulnerability is not applicable.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The transaction fee for the asset transfer transaction (Gtxn[2]) is checked to be less than or equal to 1500 microAlgos, but there is no lower bound check, which could potentially allow for a fee of 0 or a very low fee, making the transaction vulnerable to spam or other attacks.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The asset receiver for the asset transfer transaction (Gtxn[2]) is hardcoded to a specific address ('P3YBXEZ6I2XSCQVRD2ECOJ544W4K6B6JYKPE3R2TYHYLQKIH56N6MPE2HA'), but there is no mechanism to verify if this address is the intended recipient, which could lead to assets being sent to an incorrect or malicious address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The payment receiver for the main transaction (Txn) is hardcoded to a specific address ('2YINOKV3CN6PLHYXTLECTB5V6YQWP2SXGGDJUY2CDXLVHB3GOHG4WKEVCU'), but there is no mechanism to verify if this address is the intended recipient, which could lead to funds being sent to an incorrect or malicious address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not explicitly check the 'close_remainder_to' field in transaction 4 (Gtxn[3]), which could potentially allow funds to be sent to an unintended address if not properly validated.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not explicitly check the 'rekey_to' field in transaction 4 (Gtxn[3]), which could potentially allow the contract to be rekeyed to an unintended address if not properly validated.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not explicitly check the 'fee' field in transaction 4 (Gtxn[3]), which could potentially allow the transaction fee to be set higher than intended, leading to unnecessary costs.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not explicitly check the 'receiver' field in transaction 4 (Gtxn[3]) against a list of allowed addresses, which could potentially allow payments to be sent to an unintended address if not properly validated.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for transaction fees in txn1 and txn3 but not in txn2, which could allow transactions with excessive fees in the second group index.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for close remainder to address in all transactions, ensuring it is set to the zero address, which mitigates the risk of funds being sent to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Close To
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for asset close to address in all transactions, ensuring it is set to the zero address, which mitigates the risk of assets being sent to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks for rekey to address in all transactions, ensuring it is set to the zero address, which mitigates the risk of the account being rekeyed to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The transaction fee is checked against a limit but the limit is not enforced in the contract logic, potentially allowing transactions with higher fees to be processed.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The asset receiver is hardcoded in the contract, which could lead to assets being sent to an unintended address if the contract is not properly reviewed or if the address is incorrect.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The payment receivers for transactions 0 and 1 are hardcoded, similar to the asset receiver, which could lead to payments being sent to unintended addresses.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks that 'close_remainder_to' is set to the zero address, but this check is not enforced in the contract logic, potentially allowing the remainder to be sent to another address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks that 'rekey_to' is set to the zero address, but this check is not enforced in the contract logic, potentially allowing the account to be rekeyed to another address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Close To
detected_vulns.description: The contract checks that 'asset_close_to' is set to the zero address, but this check is not enforced in the contract logic, potentially allowing the asset to be closed to another address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not enforce a strict check on the transaction fee in txn2, allowing potentially high fees.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Close Remainder To
detected_vulns.description: In txn2, the contract uses an OR condition for close_remainder_to, asset_close_to, and rekey_to checks, which means not all are strictly enforced in every case.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Close To
detected_vulns.description: Similar to close_remainder_to, the asset_close_to check in txn2 is not strictly enforced due to the OR condition.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Rekey to
detected_vulns.description: The rekey_to check in txn2 is part of an OR condition, meaning it's not always strictly enforced.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The asset receiver in the inner transaction is not validated, allowing any account to be specified as the receiver.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Close To
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not check or specify the close-to address for asset transfers, which could lead to assets being sent to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: While the contract handles asset transfers, it does not explicitly check or restrict payment receivers, which could be a vector for unintended transfers.

detected_vulns.description: The contract allows the creator to update the application without any additional checks, which could be used to modify the contract in unintended ways.

detected_vulns.description: The contract allows arbitrary updates to the pension_fund global variable without proper authorization checks in the handle_fund function.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The withdraw function does not validate the receiver of the payment in the second transaction of the group, potentially allowing funds to be sent to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not check or limit the transaction fee for the inner payment transaction in the withdraw function, which could lead to excessive fees being paid.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The 'pagamento' function does not verify the receiver of the payment transaction (Gtxn[1].receiver()), which could lead to funds being sent to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary update
detected_vulns.description: The 'set_recipient' function allows the admin to update the recipient without any checks on the new recipient's address, potentially leading to unauthorized changes.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Transaction Fee
detected_vulns.description: The contract does not check the transaction fee, which could result in the admin or users paying excessive fees.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Payment Receiver
detected_vulns.description: The 'distribute_funds' function does not verify the receiver of the payment transaction (Gtxn[1]), which could lead to funds being sent to an unintended address.

detected_vulns.name: Unchecked Asset Receiver
detected_vulns.description: Although the contract deals with payments and not assets, the lack of receiver checks in 'distribute_funds' could be analogous to an unchecked asset receiver if assets were involved.

detected_vulns.name: Arbitrary Update
detected_vulns.description: The 'add_funds' function allows the owner to arbitrarily update the total funds without any checks on the amount being added, which could lead to overflow or other unintended consequences.
